titlePart.text: GENERATION, CONVERSION, OR DISTRIBUTION OF ELECTRIC POWER
SWITCHBOARDS, SWITCHYARDS, OR SWITCHGEAR, FOR THE DISTRIBUTION OF ELECTRIC POWER
titlePart.entryReference: electro-technical elements or the individual mounting thereof, see the sub-classes for such elements, e.g. transformers , switches, fuses , line connectors
interlocking between switches or between switches and gates, doors, shutters, or like movable parts of switchboards, switchyards, or switchgear
installation of lines, cables, or other conductors for distribution

noteParagraph.text: This sub-class deals with switchboards, switchyards, switchgear, or the association of switching devices with each other or with other devices, e.g. transformers, fuses, meters, distribution boards, such associations constituting substations or distribution points.

titlePart.text: INSTALLATION OF ELECTRIC CABLES OR LINES
titlePart.entryReference: distribution points incorporating switches
guiding or winding up telephone cord
cable ducts or mountings for telephone or telegraph exchange installations

noteParagraph.text: This sub-class covers installation of communication cables or lines or of lightning conductors as well as installation of power cables or lines.

titlePart.entryReference: indicating or signalling undesired working conditions , e.g. ,
locating faults along lines
emergency protective devices

noteParagraph.text: This sub-class deals only with circuit arrangements for the automatic protection of electric lines or electric machines or apparatus in the event of an undesired change from normal working conditions.

titlePart.text: CIRCUIT ARRANGEMENTS OR SYSTEMS FOR SUPPLYING OR DISTRIBUTING ELECTRIC POWER

titlePart.entryReference: interrelated control of several motors, control of a prime-mover/generator combination
control of high-frequency power
additional use of power line or power network for transmission of information

noteParagraph.text: This sub-class covers ac or dc mains or distribution networks and also deals with circuit arrangements for battery supplies, including charging or control thereof, or co-ordinated supply from two or more sources of any kind. This sub-class also covers systems for supplying or distributing electric power by electromagnetic waves. Control of a single motor, generator or converter of the types covered by sub-classes , , and , is dealt with in sub-class ; control of a single motor or generator, of the types covered by sub-class , is dealt with in that sub-class.

titlePart.entryReference: measuring instruments
dynamo-electric relays
conversion of dc or ac input power into surge output power
microphones, pick-ups, telephone receivers, loud-speakers or other transmitters or receivers of sound or other mechanical waves

noteParagraph.text: Structural adaptation of the machine for the purposes of its control is in this sub-class, but controlling motors, generators, or converters, in general, is classified in sub-class .

titlePart.text: APPARATUS FOR CONVERSION BETWEEN AC AND AC, BETWEEN AC AND DC, OR BETWEEN DC AND DC, AND FOR USE WITH MAINS OR SIMILAR POWER SUPPLY SYSTEMS
CONVERSION OF DC OR AC INPUT POWER INTO SURGE OUTPUT POWER
titlePart.entryReference: transformers
dynamo-electric converters
control of converters
pulse generators

noteParagraph.text: This sub-class deals only with circuits or apparatus for the conversion of electric power. The electrotechnical elements employed are dealt with in the appropriate sub-classes, e.g. inductors, transformers , capacitors, electrolytic rectifiers , mercury rectifying or other discharge tubes , semiconductor devices , impedance networks or resonant circuits not primarily concerned with the transfer of electric power .

titlePart.text: ELECTRIC MACHINES NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR

noteParagraph.text: This sub-class deals with (a) electrostatic generators, motors, clutches, or holding devices, (b) other non-dynamo-electric generators or motors, (c) holding or levitation devices using magnetic attraction or repulsion, and (d) arrangements for starting, regulating, braking, or otherwise controlling such machines unless in conjoint operation with a second machine.
Specific provision exists for generators, motors, and other means for converting between electric and other forms of energy, e.g. in sub-classes , , , .

titlePart.text: CONTROLLING ELECTRIC MOTORS, GENERATORS, OR CONVERTERS
titlePart.entryReference: structure of the starter, brake, or other control devices, see the appropriate sub-class, e.g. mechanical brake , mechanical speed regulator , variable resistor , starter switch
arrangements structurally associated with motors, generators, or converters, see the relevant sub-classes for the motors, generators, or converters
connection or control of one generator, transformer, or converter with regard to conjoint operation with a similar or other source of supply

noteParagraph.text: This sub-class deals with arrangements for starting, regulating, braking, or otherwise controlling motors, generators, converters, clutches, brakes, or gears, of the types classified in sub-classes , , and . Similar arrangements for the apparatus of the types classified in sub-class are dealt with in that sub-class.
